item.description:
The eastern coyote is a remarkable animal, one of the only carnivores to increase its range and distribution in the past one hundred years. Coyotes have taken over as top predator in all environments in New England, from wilderness parks to city greenbelts. Local Eastern Coyote researcher, Jon Way, will present an extensive talk
about eastern coyote ecology and behavior including over 100 pictures and many video clips.

Space is limited for this presentation so pre-registration is required. If you would like to attend this program, please call Amy at (508) 272-9376 and leave your name, contact phone number, and how many people will be attending this program with you. Program is for adults. Rain or shine.

Photo of coyote by Jon Way.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for DCR Regional Interpretive Coordinator Amy!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: The Eastern Coyote
